dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 3565 IH: To provide for a limitation on the transfer of defense articles and defense services to Israel.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Ramirez (for herself, Ms. Jacobs, Ms. Jayapal, Mr. Pocan, Ms. Balint, Mr. Carson, Mr. Casar, Mr. Doggett, Ms. Escobar, Mr. Frost, Mr. García of Illinois, Mr. Jackson of Illinois, Mr. Johnson of Georgia, Ms. Lee of Pennsylvania, Ms. Ocasio-Cortez, Ms. Omar, Ms. Pressley, Ms. Schakowsky, Ms. Simon, Ms. Tlaib, Ms. Velázquez, and Mrs. Watson Coleman) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To provide for a limitation on the transfer of defense articles and defense services to Israel.

section.header: Limitation on transfer of defense articles and defense services to Israel

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the President may not sell, transfer, or authorize a license for the export of any defense article described in subsection (b) or defense services directly related to such defense articles pursuant to any authority under the Arms Export Control Act (22 U.S.C. 2751 et seq.) or the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2151 et seq.) to the Government of Israel, or to any agency or instrumentality of Israel, unless—

paragraph.text: a law is enacted identifying the specific purpose or purposes for which such articles or services may be used for in accordance with the general purposes authorized in section 4 of the Foreign Military Sales Act (22 U.S.C. 2754); and
the Government of Israel has given written assurances satisfactory to the President that such articles and services will be used—

subparagraph.text: for the specific purposes identified in such law; and

consistent with the goals and principles described in the Arms Export Control Act (22 U.S.C. 2751 et seq.) and the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 (22 U.S.C. 2151 et seq.), including pursuant to section 620M(c) of such Act (22 U.S.C. 2378d(c)), and in accordance with international humanitarian law, international human rights law, and relevant bilateral agreements.

subsection.text: The defense articles described in this subsection are the following:

paragraph.text: GBU–39 small diameter bomb variants (including Increment I).
155mm artillery ammunition, including white phosphorus munitions.
